intro: Alyssum gehamense, commonly known as the Cape Verde alyssum, is a flowering plant native to the Cape Verde Islands. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbages. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Alyssum gehamense is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
